channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: China, Russia behind largest cross-platform misinformation operation, Meta report finds
item.description: Meta released a new report which details a misinformation campaign from Russia and China targeting the United States and various organizations.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Mexico sends a thousand more troops to Michoacan state following weekend of cartel violence
item.description: Drug cartels are wreaking havoc in the Michoacan state of Mexico. The government has deployed 1,200 more troops to contain the widespread violence.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: 7.1 magnitude earthquake strikes Indonesia’s Bali and Java islands, causing panic across the country
item.description: Panic rushed through Indonesia when a powerful earthquake with a magnitude of 7.1 and two strong aftershocks struck the country’s Bali and Java islands.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Nigerian troops rescue women, children abducted by Islamic rebels
item.description: Dozens of hostages, including toddlers and women, held by Islamic rebel group Boko Haram have been rescued in Nigeria’s northeastern region.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Guatemala's presidential election takes drastic turn as unexpected winner is certified, prompting legal fights
item.description: The corruption-plagued Central American country is facing one of the biggest tests to its democracy yet, as the recent presidential election has prompted several major legal fights.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Guatemala's presidential election takes drastic turn as unexpected winner is certified, prompting legal fights
item.description: The corruption-plagued Central American country is facing one of the biggest tests to its democracy yet, as the recent presidential election has prompted several major legal fights.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Putin is not planning to attend the funeral for Wagner chief Prigozhin, the Kremlin says
item.description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia (AP) — President Vladimir Putin is not planning to attend the funeral for Yevgeny Prigozhin, the Kremlin said, following reports that the mercenary chief who challenged the Russian leader's authority would be buried Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: AP, NewsNation

item.title: Neurosurgeon investigating patient's mystery symptoms plucks worm from woman's brain
item.description: A neurosurgeon investigating a woman’s mystery symptoms in an Australian hospital says she plucked a wriggling worm from the patient’s brain.
item.dc:creator: ROD McGUIRK Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Daughter of ex-Thai leader Thaksin says he is fatigued, as criticism grows of his hospitalization
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — Former Thai Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra is suffering from stress and fatigue but is in good spirits, his daughter said Tuesday as criticism grew of his transfer to a hospital just hours after he began serving an eight-year prison sentence.
item.dc:creator: JINTAMAS SAKSORNCHAI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Belarus fears risk of trapping citizens with ‘the beast’: opposition leader
item.description: VILNIUS, Lithuania — Belarus’s democratic opposition in exile are increasingly worried about the consequences of their country’s growing isolation due to its alliance with Russia in its war on Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, The Hill

item.title: House, Senate GOP set for internal fight over Ukraine
item.description: Senate and House Republicans are girding themselves for an internal battle over President Biden’s request for another $24 billion to continue funding the war and humanitarian assistance in Ukraine. The GOP’s divisions over the war were on full display at last week’s presidential debate.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, The Hill

item.title: Kim says North Korea must be ready against US-led invasion plots while US, allies start new drills
item.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korean leader Kim Jong Un called for his military to be constantly ready for combat to thwart its rivals’ plots to invade his country, state media said Tuesday, as the U.S.
item.dc:creator: HYUNG-JIN KIM, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Kim says North Korea must be ready against US-led invasion plots while US, allies start new drills
item.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korean leader Kim Jong Un called for his military to be constantly ready for combat to thwart its rivals’ plots to invade his country, state media said Tuesday, as the U.S.
item.dc:creator: HYUNG-JIN KIM, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Sudan’s military leader visits Egypt on his first trip abroad since the country plunged into war
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — Sudan’s top military officer arrived in Egypt on Tuesday on his first trip abroad since the country plunged into a bitter conflict this year, authorities said. Gen.
item.dc:creator: SAMY MAGDY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Sudan’s military leader visits Egypt on his first trip abroad since the country plunged into war
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — Sudan’s top military officer arrived in Egypt on Tuesday on his first trip abroad since the country plunged into a bitter conflict this year, authorities said. Gen.
item.dc:creator: SAMY MAGDY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Pakistani court suspends the corruption conviction and sentence of former Prime Minister Imran Khan
item.description: A defense lawyer says a Pakistani appeals court has suspended the corruption conviction and three-year prison term of Imran Khan in a legal victory for the embattled former prime minister.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: London’s plan to charge drivers of polluting cars sparks protests and stirs political passions
item.description: LONDON (AP) — London’s traffic cameras are under attack. Police say hundreds of license plate-reading cameras have been damaged, disconnected or stolen by opponents of an anti-pollution charge on older vehicles that comes into force across the metropolis on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: JILL LAWLESS, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: London’s plan to charge drivers of polluting cars sparks protests and stirs political passions
item.description: LONDON (AP) — London’s traffic cameras are under attack. Police say hundreds of license plate-reading cameras have been damaged, disconnected or stolen by opponents of an anti-pollution charge on older vehicles that comes into force across the metropolis on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: JILL LAWLESS, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Syria protests spurred by economic misery stir memories of the 2011 anti-government uprising
item.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Anti-government protests in southern Syria have stretched into a second week, with demonstrators waving the colorful flag of the minority Druze community, burning banners of President Bashar Assad's government and at one point raiding several offices of his ruling party.
item.dc:creator: KAREEM CHEHAYEB, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Pope Francis draws fire after praising Russian empire
item.description: Pope Francis is under fire for recent comments where he appeared to praise the Russian empire in an address to Russian Catholic youths, sparking criticism from both state and religious leaders in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Miranda Nazzaro, The Hill

item.title: Pope Francis draws fire after praising Russian empire
item.description: Pope Francis is under fire for recent comments where he appeared to praise the Russian empire in an address to Russian Catholic youths, sparking criticism from both state and religious leaders in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Miranda Nazzaro, The Hill

item.title: Guatemala progressive's presidential victory certified, but his party is suspended
item.description: Progressive candidate Bernardo Arévalo was confirmed the winner of Guatemala’s presidential election by the country’s Supreme Electoral Tribunal on Monday, but the same day another government body ordered his political party suspended.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: British bog snorkeling championship contenders race through slime
item.description: Intrepid athletes donned snorkels and slithered through slime on Sunday during one of Britain’s quirkiest sporting events: the World Bog Snorkeling Championships.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Virginia man stolen at birth meets Chilean family for first time
item.description: A 42-year-old Virginia man got to embrace his birth mother for the first time during a long-awaited family reunion in Valdivia, Chile.
item.dc:creator: Taylor Delandro, NewsNation

item.title: UN investigators traveling to Ukraine to probe allegations of Russian abuse
item.description: Members of the United Nations commission investigating allegations against Russia of human rights abuse are traveling Monday to Ukraine for the group’s third “fact-finding mission.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Fortinsky, The Hill

item.title: US, China to discuss export controls, officials say
item.description: U.S. Secretary of Commerce Gina Raimondo announced Monday that she and her Chinese counterpart agreed to discuss export controls in an ongoing effort to ease tensions between the two global economic powerhouses.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Fortinsky, The Hill

item.title: Bog snorkeling championships: Competitors race through slime in British contest
item.description: Intrepid athletes donned snorkels and slithered through slime on Sunday during one of Britain’s quirkiest sporting events: the World Bog Snorkeling Championships.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: 8 US Marines remain in a hospital after a fiery aircraft crash killed 3 during drills in Australia
item.description: CANBERRA, Australia (AP) — Eight U.S. Marines remained in a hospital in the Australian north coast city of Darwin on Monday after they were injured in a fiery crash of a tiltrotor aircraft that killed three of their colleagues on an island.
item.dc:creator: ROD McGUIRK, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Russia says it confirmed Wagner leader Prigozhin died in a plane crash
item.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russian authorities on Sunday confirmed the death of Wagner Group chief Yevgeny Prigozhin, putting to rest any doubts about whether the wily mercenary leader turned mutineer was on a plane that crashed Wednesday, killing everyone on board.
item.dc:creator: AP, NewsNation

item.title: With drones and webcams, volunteer hunters join new search for mythical Loch Ness Monster
item.description: Mystery hunters converged on a Scottish lake on Saturday to look for signs of the mythical Loch Ness Monster.
item.dc:creator: Jill Lawless, WFLA, NBC

item.title: India's lunar rover keeps walking on the moon, days after spacecraft's historic touchdown
item.description: NEW DELHI (AP) — India's lunar rover continued its walk on the moon Friday after the historic touch-down of India's spacecraft near the moon's south pole earlier this week, the country's space agency said.
item.dc:creator: ASHOK SHARMA, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: From tarantulas to tigers, zoo animals step onto scales for annual weigh-in
item.description: Staff at London Zoo got the measure of giant gorillas, plump penguins and skinny stick insects at the zoo’s annual animal weigh-in on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Dutch brewer Heineken sells its Russian operations for 1 euro, taking a 300-million-euro hit
item.description: THE HAGUE, Netherlands (AP) — Dutch brewer Heineken has completed its withdrawal from Russia, 18 months after Moscow launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine, selling its business in Russia for just 1 euro, the company announced Friday.
item.dc:creator: AP, WGN 9

item.title: FIFA opens case against Spanish soccer official who kissed player on lips at Women's World Cup
item.description: FIFA opened a disciplinary case Thursday against the Spanish soccer official who kissed a player on the lips while celebrating the team's victory in the Women’s World Cup final.
item.dc:creator: Graham Dunbar, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Putin breaks silence on plane crash that presumably killed Wagner leaders
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has broken his silence on the plane crash that killed top leaders of the Wagner mercenary group.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Jet crash in Russia kills 10 and Wagner chief was on passenger list, officials say
item.description: A business jet en route from Moscow to St. Petersburg crashed Wednesday, killing all 10 people on board, Russian emergency officials said. Mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin was on the passenger list, officials said, but it wasn't immediately clear if he was on board.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: India successfully lands its Chandrayaan-3 rover on the moon, near the south pole
item.description: NEW DELHI (AP) — India was counting down to landing a spacecraft near the moon’s south pole Wednesday — an unchartered territory that scientists believe could hold important reserves of frozen water and precious elements.
item.dc:creator: ASHOK SHARMA, Associated Press, WGN 9
